content.text: Bash scripts are sequences of commands executed by the Bash shell. They automate tasks and can be used to perform complex operations. Understanding Bash syntax is crucial for writing effective scripts.
content.html: Bash scripts are sequences of commands executed by the Bash shell. They automate tasks and can be used to perform complex operations. Understanding Bash syntax is crucial for writing effective scripts.

content.text: Here are some basic rules for using Bash in scripts:
content.html: Here are some basic rules for using Bash in scripts:

content.text: Let's go through them one by one with examples.
content.html: Let's go through them one by one with examples.

content.text: Comments start with a # and Bash ignores them. They explain what your code does, making it easier to understand.
content.html: Comments start with a # and Bash ignores them. They explain what your code does, making it easier to understand.

content.code:
# This script prints a greeting message


echo

"Hello, World!"
content.code_html:
# This script prints a greeting message
echo "Hello, World!"

content.text: Commands are run (or executed) in sequence from top to bottom
content.html: Commands are run (or executed) in sequence from top to bottom

content.text: This order affects the logic and functionality of the script.
content.html: This order affects the logic and functionality of the script.

content.code_html:
echo "First command"
echo "Second command"

content.text: Semicolons ; can be used to separate multiple commands on the same line, which is useful for writing concise scripts.
content.html: Semicolons ; can be used to separate multiple commands on the same line, which is useful for writing concise scripts.

content.code:
echo

"This is a test"
;

echo

"This is another test"
content.code_html: echo "This is a test"; echo "This is another test"
